SENT.plain: Examination of 37 patients with Marfan's syndrome has revealed acute disorders of the cerebral circulation, aneurysms of the spinal vessels, varicose spinal veins, myopathy-like syndrome, atlantal semiluxation, spondylolisthesis, epilepsy and cephalgia
The data of additional examinations conducted in patients with Marfan's syndrome with and without neurological symptomatology are presented
The questions concerning the prevention, pathogenesis and therapy of neurological disturbances associated with Marfan's syndrome are considered
